title: Elise Pham
text:
Hi there! I’m Elise, a fourth-year undergraduate student at UCLA pursuing a degree in statistics and data science. I’m passionate about turning complex data into tangible results and helping people understand more about elaborate concepts in a clear and engaging way.
I am actively seeking opportunities to develop innovative solutions where I can apply my strong analytical and teamwork skills to derive actionable insights.
My interests include hiking, traveling, cafe hopping, watching animated shows, and collecting trinkets of all kinds!

title: Elise Pham

title: Projects
text:
Home Improvement AI Workflow | Feb 2025 - March 2025
Github repository
Technologies: Python, Gemini Google AI

Designed a 3-step input-processing-output pipeline using Goose, transforming vague user inputs into actionable tasks
Delivered detailed AI-generated justifications for each task, explain reasoning behind 4+ task recommendations
Automated task prioritization to optimize home improvement plans, reducing planning time by 70% compared to manual research



NBA 2023-2024 Games Prediction | Nov 2024 - Dec 2024
Github repository
Technologies: Python, Google Colab, scikit-learn, Matplotlib, seaborn

Developed 3 predictive features for game outcomes using 5 machine learning algorithms, such as Random Forest and SVM.

Preprocessed 2,460 entries by performing EDA, developing weighted functions, and classifying observations as binary outputs.

Tuned models using PCA and K-fold cross-validation, achieving 70% testing accuracy for Logistic Regression.



Music Analysis Dashboard | Aug 2024 - Aug 2024
Github repository
Technologies: SQL, PowerBI

Designed a PowerBI dashboard with visual graphs to analyze trends from a music database of 2,500+ entries
Developed 10 SQL queries using joins, CTEs, aggregate functions, and more for data manipulation
Analyzed data-driven decision making and risk management with 5 clear, actionable insight



Multiple Linear Regression: Solar Radiation Prediction | Feb 2024 - Mar 2024
Technologies: R, RStudio

Predicted Solar Radiation level through a multiple linear regression model and 3 R visual diagnostic plots
Determined relationship and distribution of 9 variables after data mining and statistical packages utilization
Concluded that an increase in temperature resulted in an increase of radiation by 12.474 units



Binary Image Cats and Dogs Classification | Jan 2024 - Mar 2024
Github repository
Technologies: Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Google Colab

Collaborated with a team of 10 to program a model that analyzed whether an image was a cat or dog, testing on 2000 images
Implemented machine learning models and CNNs, leveraging techniques like data regularization to improve generalization
Compiled individual models and algorithms onto Google Colab to result in an 80% project accuracy rate
